review: Pros:  Love the stick because I love streaming video from Amazon Prime to my TVs.  I also have a Roku stick and it is far more responsive than that little sucker at $10 less.Cons: My biggest issue is the fact that it operates best when plugged into an outlet.  Are you guys aware that the tv area already requires approximately 1 million things to be plugged in in that vicinity?  What is the point of making it this cool little unobtrusive stick if I have to dangle a power cord from it in order for it to work properly?  Additionally, the adapter has a very short reach.  If you have your tv on the wall and it in not 2 feet from the outlet, this is a problem. Second the adapter takes up so much space on a power strip I can't use the plug next to it  Why is this necessary? I tried just plugging in the USB to power it, but when I use it this way, I get a 'not enough power to charge stick' message and the sounds gets warbly and off from the video.Do I use it?  Yes?  Do I really sort of expect better thought out user experience from Amazon?  Also, yes.  Would I buy an additional one?  Argh.  Probably not.
